paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 gene variant R176W, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: asymptomatic LQT2 patient with occasional palpitations

individual_records.phenotype_details: occasional palpitations, which although are not specific symptoms of LQTS
individual_records.evidence_sentence: In addition, skin biopsies were obtained from a 61-year old male asymptomatic LQT2 patient with the KCNH2 R176W mutation (QTc interval, 437 ms).

functional_data.summary: The KCNH2 R176W mutation is associated with reduced potassium efflux, leading to long QT syndrome.

variants.evidence_level: Likely pathogenic based on functional studies and clinical presentation.
variants.additional_notes: The patient is asymptomatic but carries the variant.
key_quotes: In addition, skin biopsies were obtained from a 61-year old male asymptomatic LQT2 patient with the KCNH2 R176W mutation (QTc interval, 437 ms).

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text.
